page.title: 01Bassenthwaite @ Surroundings
page.content: { Bassenthwaite village}is half a mile from the {A591,}on the N.W.fringe of the{Lake District.}Mixed farming is the main occupation, along with some forestry, but there is a growing tourist trade,encouraging bed-and- breakfast, hotels, and caravan sites. The area around Bassenthwaite offers woods, fells, waterfalls, streams, rivers,and{Bassenthwaite Lake.}The lake is one of the shallowest in the Lake District, with sailing facilities,walks by the shores, and an abundance of wild and animal life. There is an infrequent bus service along the A591, and the nearest shopping centres are 7 miles away.There is a travelling grocer's van calling twice a week, a part-time post office, and a school which is rapidly growing smaller, as houses are bought for holiday homes.
